KnowledgeBase.contextInfoTip: Context sources are the files, links, or text that the bot uses to answer questions. You can add, remove, or edit them as needed. The bot will use the most relevant sources to provide accurate answers.
KnowledgeBase.searchTip: Search by source name.  Enter part of a file, web page or text title to filter the list.
KnowledgeBase.addContextTip: Import a new data source: file, web page or text.
KnowledgeBase.uploadSub: Select a file or drag it here.
KnowledgeBase.uploadTypes: Supported types: PDF, TXT, Images, DOCX, XLSX, images
KnowledgeBase.queryFieldTip: Enter your question or request. The AI will use the context sources to provide a relevant answer.
KnowledgeBase.typeHereTip: Describe what the AI assistant should do with your data‚Ä¶
KnowledgeBase.uploadSourcesSubtitle: Select a file or drag it here.
KnowledgeBase.uploadSourcesTypes: Supported types: PDF, TXT, images, DOCX, XLSX
KnowledgeBase.addTopicDesc: Topic ‚Äì the main theme that combines related subtopics. Subtopic ‚Äì a subsection of the main topic with a specific focus. Question ‚Äì a typical user question within a subtopic. Answer ‚Äì a detailed response to a specific question.
KnowledgeBase.topicTooltip: The main topic containing related subsections and questions.
KnowledgeBase.subtopicTooltip: A section of a topic that groups related questions and answers.
KnowledgeBase.questionTooltip: A question in the knowledge base that the bot will look for answers to.
KnowledgeBase.answerTooltip: An answer to a question that the bot will use when formulating responses.
KnowledgeBase.playgroundEmptyBody: Import content from the left panel or create a new block.
KnowledgeBase.saveDesc: Saves the current knowledge structure as a draft. You can return to it later. The draft is not used by the bot to answer questions until you publish it.
KnowledgeBase.publishDesc: 'Publishes the knowledge structure to the main knowledge base, which the bot will use to answer user questions.  Changes take effect immediately.  Make sure the structure is completely ready.'
KnowledgeBase.knowledgeBaseDesc: Knowledge base is the main source of information for the bot. It contains all the topics, subtopics, and questions that the bot can answer. You can view and search through it, but you cannot edit it directly here.
KnowledgeBase.purposeNoneDesc: The source is ignored when generating answers.
KnowledgeBase.purposeBotDesc: Information is added to the knowledge base and influences general answers.
KnowledgeBase.purposeKbDesc: The source is used only to answer the specific question.
KnowledgeBase.purposeBothDesc: The source is used for both general knowledge and specific query answers.
KnowledgeBase.confirmClear:
Clear playground?

All draft changes will be lost. This will NOT touch the real knowledge base.
KnowledgeBase.confirmReject:
Reject playground?

Draft changes will be lost. The real knowledge base stays intact.
KnowledgeBase.unsavedChanges: You have unsaved changes in the playground!

playground.saveDraft: Saves the current knowledge structure as a draft. You will be able to continue working with it later. The draft is not used by the bot to answer questions until you publish it.
playground.publish: Publishes the knowledge structure to the main knowledge base, which the bot will use to answer user questions. After publication, changes take effect immediately, and the bot will start responding using the new data. Make sure the structure is completely ready.
playground.blockType:
Topic ‚Äì the main theme that combines related subtopics.
Subtopic ‚Äì a subsection of the main topic with a specific focus.
Question ‚Äì a typical user question within a subtopic.
Answer ‚Äì a detailed response to a specific question.
playground.parentBlock:
Select the block to which the created element will relate.
Follow the correct hierarchy:
‚Ä¢ Subtopics are created within Topics
‚Ä¢ Questions are created within Subtopics
‚Ä¢ Answers are created for specific Questions

import.sourceSearch: Search by source name. Enter part of the file name, web page, or text document to filter the list.
import.importNew: Import a new data source: file, web page, or text.
import.aiInput: Write here what the AI assistant should do with your data. Example: "Highlight the main services from my website and create questions and answers for them". Press Enter or the send button to convert selected sources into a structured knowledge base.
import.generator:
Write to the AI assistant specific tasks for structuring your data. Examples:
‚Ä¢ "Create Q&A pairs from a product document"
‚Ä¢ "Divide text into subtopics"
‚Ä¢ "Form a menu of services from my price list"
‚Ä¢ "Extract key benefits"

kbBlock.topic: The main topic containing related subsections and questions.
kbBlock.subtopic: A section of a topic that groups related questions and answers.
kbBlock.question: A question in the knowledge base that the bot will look for answers to.
kbBlock.answer: An answer to a question that the bot will use when formulating responses.

info.applyKb: It will CHANGE the knowledge base.
